question.title: Adding elements to a multidimensional Array

node.contents: I currently have an ArrayList (mapArray) such that each element of the ArrayList contains a String such as:

astNode.text: I currently have an ArrayList (mapArray) such that each element of the ArrayList contains a String such as:

node.contents: So the ArrayList could look as such:

astNode.text: So the ArrayList could look as such:

node.contents: How would i go about adding this data to a multidimensional array so that the first element would be the row number and the second element would be the character e.g. 2DArray[2][9] = G

astNode.text: How would i go about adding this data to a multidimensional array so that the first element would be the row number and the second element would be the character e.g. 2DArray[2][9] = G

elements.contents: for(int i = 0; i < length; i++){ String element = mapArray.get(i); elementSplit = element.split("(?!^)"); for(int j = 0; j < elementSplit.length; j++){ TwoDArray [i][j] = [i][elementSplit[j]]; } }

units.rawText: for(int i = 0; i < length; i++){ String element = mapArray.get(i); elementSplit = element.split("(?!^)"); for(int j = 0; j < elementSplit.length; j++){ TwoDArray [i][j] = [i][elementSplit[j]]; } }

node.contents: This method converts a String ArrayList to char[][]. Hope this helps.

astNode.text: This method converts a String ArrayList to char[][]. Hope this helps.

elements.contents: public static char[][] to2DCharArray(ArrayList<String> mapArray) { char[][] c = new char[mapArray.size()][mapArray.get(0).length()]; for(int i = 0; i < mapArray.size(); i++) { for(int j = 0; j < mapArray.get(i).length(); j++) { c[i][j] = mapArray.get(i).charAt(j); } } return c; }

units.rawText: public static char[][] to2DCharArray(ArrayList<String> mapArray) { char[][] c = new char[mapArray.size()][mapArray.get(0).length()]; for(int i = 0; i < mapArray.size(); i++) { for(int j = 0; j < mapArray.get(i).length(); j++) { c[i][j] = mapArray.get(i).charAt(j); } } return c; }

elements.contents: char[][] TwoDArray = new char[mapArray.size()][]; for (int i=0; i<mapArray.size(); i++) { TwoDArray[i] = mapArray.get(i).toCharArray(); }

units.rawText: char[][] TwoDArray = new char[mapArray.size()][]; for (int i=0; i<mapArray.size(); i++) { TwoDArray[i] = mapArray.get(i).toCharArray(); }

node.contents: Be aware that, in your case, the letter G is the position TwoDArray[2][9]

astNode.text: Be aware that, in your case, the letter G is the position TwoDArray[2][9]
